intro: Huperzia humbertii-henrici, commonly known as the Humbert's huperzia, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Hypolepidaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered growth habit. The plant produces spore-bearing structures called sporangia, which are typically located on the underside of its leaves. Huperzia humbertii-henrici is native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
